We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Head, Human Capital Manager&nbsp;

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities
People Strategy &amp; Workforce Planning:


	Develop and execute a Human Capital strategy aligned with the Bank&rsquo;s corporate strategy
	Lead workforce planning, succession, reskilling, mobility, and annual HR budgets
	Partner with Executive Management on organizational design, capability building, and growth initiatives


Talent Acquisition &amp; Employer Branding:


	Oversee end-to-end recruitment for critical roles using fair, inclusive, and data-driven practices
	Strengthen employer brand through graduate programs, leadership pipelines, and talent initiatives
	Govern recruitment SLAs, onboarding quality, and candidate experience


Performance, Rewards &amp; Recognition:


	Own performance management frameworks (OKRs/KPIs, calibration, feedback cycles)
	Design and manage compensation structures, job evaluation, incentives, and recognition programs
	Ensure full compliance with statutory obligations (PENCOM, NHF, NSITF, ITF, tax)


Learning, Leadership &amp; Capability Development:


	Drive leadership development and functional academies (Credit, Risk, Sales, Operations, Digital)
	Implement structured learning pathways, certifications, and succession planning
	Maintain strong talent pipelines and bench strength for critical roles


Culture, Engagement &amp; DEI:


	Lead culture transformation initiatives aligned with values, ethics, and leadership behaviors
	Drive employee engagement, wellbeing, and recognition programs
	Champion Diversity, Equity &amp; Inclusion across hiring, development, and rewards

	Oversee HR operations including payroll, benefits, exits, and policy governance
	Lead HR digital transformation (HRIS, ATS, LMS, performance systems, analytics)
	Ensure data integrity, automation, SLA compliance, and continuous improvement


Employee Relations, Governance &amp; Compliance:


	Manage employee relations, disciplinary processes, and industrial relations (where applicable)
	Ensure compliance with Nigerian Labour Act, NDPR, health &amp; safety, and internal policies
	Maintain HR risk register, audit readiness, controls, and Board-level reporting


Executive Advisory &amp; Change Leadership:


	Act as strategic advisor to Executive Management on culture, transformation, and change
	Lead people due diligence, integrations, and organizational transformation initiatives.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess relevant qualifications with 12-15 years of relevant experience in banking industry.&nbsp;


Salary
N3,000,000 - N5,000,000 / month.&nbsp;

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;tophireafrica@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

Head, Human Capital Manager  Job at TopHire Africa




        
    

        
        TopHire Africa is a timeless and innovative HR-Consulting Service provider that's geared towards delivering recruitment and training of qualitative verified talent.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Head, Human Capital Manager 

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities
People Strategy & Workforce Planning:
     

            
    




	Develop and execute a Human Capital strategy aligned with the Bank’s corporate strategy
	Lead workforce planning, succession, reskilling, mobility, and annual HR budgets
	Partner with Executive Management on organizational design, capability building, and growth initiatives


Talent Acquisition & Employer Branding:


	Oversee end-to-end recruitment for critical roles using fair, inclusive, and data-driven practices
	Strengthen employer brand through graduate programs, leadership pipelines, and talent initiatives
	Govern recruitment SLAs, onboarding quality, and candidate experience


Performance, Rewards & Recognition:


	Own performance management frameworks (OKRs/KPIs, calibration, feedback cycles)
	Design and manage compensation structures, job evaluation, incentives, and recognition programs
	Ensure full compliance with statutory obligations (PENCOM, NHF, NSITF, ITF, tax)


Learning, Leadership & Capability Development:


	Drive leadership development and functional academies (Credit, Risk, Sales, Operations, Digital)
	Implement structured learning pathways, certifications, and succession planning
	Maintain strong talent pipelines and bench strength for critical roles


Culture, Engagement & DEI:


	Lead culture transformation initiatives aligned with values, ethics, and leadership behaviors
	Drive employee engagement, wellbeing, and recognition programs
	Champion Diversity, Equity & Inclusion across hiring, development, and rewards


HR Operations, Digital & Shared Services:


	Oversee HR operations including payroll, benefits, exits, and policy governance
	Lead HR digital transformation (HRIS, ATS, LMS, performance systems, analytics)
	Ensure data integrity, automation, SLA compliance, and continuous improvement


Employee Relations, Governance & Compliance:


	Manage employee relations, disciplinary processes, and industrial relations (where applicable)
	Ensure compliance with Nigerian Labour Act, NDPR, health & safety, and internal policies
	Maintain HR risk register, audit readiness, controls, and Board-level reporting


Executive Advisory & Change Leadership:


	Act as strategic advisor to Executive Management on culture, transformation, and change
	Lead people due diligence, integrations, and organizational transformation initiatives.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess relevant qualifications with 12-15 years of relevant experience in banking industry. 


Salary
N3,000,000 - N5,000,000 / month. 

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: tophireafrica@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

	We are seeking a Sales Associate to join our team.
	The ideal candidate will deliver excellent customer service, support sales operations, and maintain an attractive, well-organized showroom.

	Prepare customer orders for pickup or delivery as required.
